result.markdown:
---
title: "Visualizando as distribuições"
author: "Ricardo Accioly"
date: "2023-08-24"
format:
 html:
    code-link: true
---


## Carregando as bibliotecas

Vamos trabalhar de novo com os dados do gapminder para fazer algumas visualizações de dados que são muito úteis no dia a dia.

Este material foi adaptado do curso Data Visualization in R with ggplot2 de Kara Woo


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library("ggplot2")
library("dplyr")
library("gapminder")
```
:::


\newpage

## Selecionando dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gap_07 <- filter(gapminder, year == 2007)
```
:::


## Vendo a distribuição


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(gap_07, aes(x = gdpPercap)) +
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/histograma-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Criando um histograma usando a regra de Sturges

A regra de Sturges indica 8 faixas enquanto que o padrão do ggplot2 é 30.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(gap_07, aes(x = gdpPercap)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = round(1+3.322*log10(nrow(gap_07)),0))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/Sturges-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Criando um gráfico de densidade


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(gap_07, aes(x = gdpPercap)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/densidade-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Criando um box-plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(gap_07, aes(x = continent, y = lifeExp)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/box-plot-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Criando um box-plot com visão dos dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(gap_07, aes(x = continent, y = lifeExp)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.5, alpha = 0.2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/jitter-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Matriz de Correlações


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(corrplot)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
corrplot 0.92 loaded
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
gap_07_s <- gap_07 %>% select(lifeExp, pop, gdpPercap)
mat_corr <- cor(gap_07_s)
corrplot(mat_corr, method = "number", col = "black", cl.pos = "n")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/correlações-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
corrplot(mat_corr, method = "number")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/correlações-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
corrplot(mat_corr)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/correlações-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## SPLOM


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(psych)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

Attaching package: 'psych'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
The following objects are masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    %+%, alpha
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pairs.panels(gap_07_s)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/splom-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(GGally)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally':
  method from   
  +.gg   ggplot2
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggpairs(gap_07_s)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula03_files/figure-html/splom2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


\newpage

## Descrevendo a distribuição


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(datawizard)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

Attaching package: 'datawizard'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
The following object is masked from 'package:psych':

    rescale
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
describe_distribution(gap_07_s)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Variable  |     Mean |       SD |      IQR |                Range | Skewness | Kurtosis |   n | n_Missing
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
lifeExp   |    67.01 |    12.07 |    19.59 |       [39.61, 82.60] |    -0.69 |    -0.83 | 142 |         0
pop       | 4.40e+07 | 1.48e+08 | 2.78e+07 | [2.00e+05, 1.32e+09] |     7.40 |    58.33 | 142 |         0
gdpPercap | 11680.07 | 12859.94 | 16579.19 |   [277.55, 49357.19] |     1.22 |     0.35 | 142 |         0
```
:::
:::
